headline: Stanford '28
about: Researcher that is interested in the field of machine learning and automation. Has created a multitude of projects on Github using a combination of Python and React. Focused on building LLM applications and models.

experience.summary:
- Worked on projects in the Computer Vision and Intelligent Systems Laboratory, delivering successful outcomes on time while securing funding from NASA, USGS, and Physmodo Inc.- Utilized bi-stream convolutional neural networks and deep learning autoencoders to identify cropland levees and optimize crop and farming structure placement, resulting in increased efficiency and reduced environmental impact.- Developed a novel human tracking method using point clouds and depth videos to improve pose estimation and monitoring accuracy, creating visualizations and demonstrations in MATLAB- Designed and implemented computer vision algorithms for real-time video tracking, leveraging expertise in convolutional neural networks, machine learning, and statistical analysis to achieve robust performance and high accuracy.

certification.certification: MTA: Introduction to Programming Using Java - Certified

awards.name: 1st Place Elite Solo Project
awards.summary: - First among 280+ ParticipantsReceived first place for developing Koios GPT, a web app that combines AI algorithms and LLMs to process research articles and PDFs. Users can upload documents and utilize a built-in search feature for efficient article retrieval.

awards.name: 1st Place Overall
awards.summary: - First among 80+ ParticipantsReceived first place overall for developing Koios GPT, a web app that combines AI algorithms and LLMs to process research articles and PDFs. Users can upload documents and utilize a built-in search feature for efficient article retrieval.

awards.name: Winner of Hack Your Portfolio
awards.summary: - Winner among 290+ ParticipantsDeveloped Sign Ease, an innovative app that utilizes machine learning to accurately interpret sign language gestures, empowering sign language users with enhanced communication and accessibility.

awards.name: 1st Place Education Hack
awards.summary: First among 151+ ParticipantsReceived first place in the education category for developing Transcribi, a web app that utilizes cutting-edge technologies such as OpenAI GPT, OpenAI Whisper, and Langchain to provide users with accurate and efficient audio transcription, as well as advanced analysis capabilities.

awards.name: 1st Place Generative AI and Best Pitch
awards.summary: First among 275+ ParticipantsDeveloped SightSense: a wearable device that utilizes object detection, voice commands, and text-to-speech functionality to aid individuals with visual impairments in navigating their surroundings in real-time.

awards.name: LaunchHacks II: 1st Place
awards.summary: First Among 740+ ParticipantsReadSpeak is a comprehensive app designed to help users improve their reading and pronunciation skills. With its user-friendly interface and advanced features, ReadSpeak is the perfect tool for anyone looking to enhance their language abilities.

awards.name: TAMS Summer Scholarship Recipient
awards.summary: - Awarded $4000 for the continuation of work over the summer in utilizing bi-stream convolutional neural networks and deep learning autoencoders to identify cropland levees and optimize crop and farming structure placement

awards.name: TSA State Finalist - Data Science and Analytics
awards.summary: - Managed comprehensive Covid-19 data collection from reputable sources, including vaccine and variant data.- Analyzed coronavirus data with linear regression and Support Vector Models (SVMs) to forecast future Covid cases and outbreaks.- Coordinated with team members to optimize machine learning models and increase accuracy.- Presented findings and work at the Dallas TSA regional competition for Data Science and Analytics, becoming a finalist.
